site.tagline: A readable, neutral product landing template.
site.description: A small landing template for products: clear sections, editable copy, and optional motion/3D patterns.
site.gradient: radial-gradient(circle at 20% 0%, rgba(14, 165, 233, 0.20), transparent 55%), radial-gradient(circle at 90% 30%, rgba(52, 211, 153, 0.16), transparent 45%)

seo.title: Product Landing — Landing starter
seo.description: A readable, neutral product landing template.

fonts.sans: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, "Segoe UI", Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji"
fonts.mono: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, "Liberation Mono", "Courier New", monospace

hero.headline: A clean landing page that stays editable.
hero.subheadline: Keep the layout stable while you iterate on message, screenshots, and docs links.

socialProof.title: Used by (placeholder)
socialProof.note: Replace with real references when available — or disable the section.

features.title: What it helps you show
features.description: Use short paragraphs, avoid hype, and link to docs where needed.

items.title: Clear structure
items.description: Hero, features, how-it-works, testimonials, FAQ, and CTA.

items.title: Editable defaults
items.description: All copy and lists live in `src/config/content.ts`.

items.title: Brand variables
items.description: Colors, gradient, and links live in `src/config/site.ts`.

items.title: Optional patterns
items.description: Motion and 3D are included as optional patterns, not requirements.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.description: Keep the copy concrete: what it does, who it’s for, and what it’s not.

steps.title: Describe the problem
steps.description: Start with one sentence and refine as you learn.

steps.title: List the core features
steps.description: Prefer fewer items with clearer descriptions.

steps.title: Point to docs
steps.description: Link to a README or docs page instead of over-explaining.

testimonials.title: Testimonials (placeholder)
testimonials.description: Replace with real quotes, or disable until you have them.

items.quote: Reduced motion support is a good default.
items.name: Name

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Use this to set expectations and link out to real docs.

items.question: Where do I edit content?
items.answer: Update `src/config/content.ts`. Each section is a typed object with an `enabled` toggle.

items.question: Can I remove motion?
items.answer: Yes. Motion respects reduced motion, and you can remove Framer Motion if you want.

cta.title: Get it running locally
cta.description: Install, run init, then iterate on copy and links.

tech.title: Modern stack, small surface area
tech.description: Vite + React + TypeScript, styled with Tailwind. Motion and 3D are optional.

bullets.title: Fast dev loop
bullets.description: Vite-based dev server and a static build.

bullets.title: Reduced motion support
bullets.description: Animations reduce automatically when users ask for it.
